title.narrative: Full Circle Tax Watch in West Africa

description.narrative:
Kids <(>&<)> Teens Nigeria in collaboration with ARCAD SIDA- Mali, Peer Review Forum -Nigeria, Accountability International -South Africa and Society for AIDS in Africa –Ghana will implement the Full Circle Tax Watch for Marginalised Populations project.
The project aims to promote greater inclusion of young people’s voices and priorities in the formulation and oversight of budgetary and taxpolicy processes and issues in Nigeria, Mali and Ghana. The project will empower young people to self – advocate, generate evidencebased research and policy recommendations. The evidence based research and policy recommendations to influence and catalyze the creation of and access to open political spaces, processes and participation for young people.
The Implementation phase of the projectwill contribute to the realization of Impact Area 3 of the VOICE programme.
The design phase of the Full Circle Tax Watch for Marginalised Populations project commenced in 2020 and has been completed. Lessons learnt and innovations from the design phase and the Livening Linking and Learning engagements have informed the development of the Implementation Phase of the project. The Implementation phase of the Full Circle Tax Watch for Marginalised Populations project will commence in May 2021 and end in 2022. This second phase will be implemented in Nigeria, Mali and Nigeria.

participating-org.narrative:
Kids <(>&<)> Teens Resource Centre (K<(>&<)>TRC) is a registered non-governmental organisation established in 2002 to advance, promote and support efforts of government and all other stakeholders involved in children and young people developmental activities. K<(>&<)>TRC has been working with children and young people for the past 14 years and has made remarkable impacts in the lives of youngpeople in communities through continuous service provision, information sharing, capacity development, mentoring, and participatorycommunity development.
K<(>&<)>TRC envisions a #secured future# where young people are empowered to actively participate and contribute to the sustainable development of their own communities. The mission is to create an enabling environment that equips young people with the knowledge and skills required for their self-actualization and development.
K<(>&<)>TRC has her head office in Akure, with physical offices in 4 states across 3 of the 6 geo-political zones of Nigeria namely Ondo, Ekiti, Kwara and Plateau States. K<(>&<)>TRC is also a member of many national civil society networks in Nigeria. In the African Region, K<(>&<)>TRC coordinates young people on HIV <(>&<)> AIDS in West Africa. K<(>&<)>TRC led many advocacy to First Ladies of West African Countries for more responsive participation of the First Ladies on Adolescent Girls and Young Women interventions across Republic of Benin, Ghana, Togo, Nigeriaand Cote D#Ivorie.
